item.title: Architectural breakdown: Binary
item.description: … and it all begins with binary. Binary is a ‘base 2’ numbering system which means it uses the numbers 0 and 1. In contrast humans tend to use decimal (base 10) for their day-to-day numerical needs which, of course, uses the numbers 0 to 9.
